snippet: The lawyer for Reza Zarrab, who has offered to pay for his own detention while awaiting trial, said the inequities in the criminal justice system were not his client’s fault.
abstract: Lawyer for Reza Zarrab, Turkish gold trader accused of conspiring to violate American sanctions on Iran, requests his release from pretrial detention on $50 million bond, promising 24-hour home monitoring of trader; federal prosecutors ask court to deny bail, citing overwhelming evidence against Zarrab and arguing he presents extraordinary flight risk.
lead_paragraph: The lawyer for Reza Zarrab, who has offered to pay for his own detention while awaiting trial, said the inequities in the criminal justice system were not his client’s fault.

headline.main: Lawyer for Gold Trader From Turkey Asks Judge Not to Punish Him for Being Rich
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Says Gold Trader Is No Threat to Jump Bail
